it.reply.orchestrator.service.deployment.providers

Class ChronosServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.reply.orchestrator.service.deployment.providers.AbstractDeploymentProviderService
      • it.reply.orchestrator.service.deployment.providers.ChronosServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeploymentProviderService

    @Service
 @Qualifier(value="CHRONOS")
 @PropertySource(value={"classpath:application.properties","${chronos.auth.file.path}"})
public class ChronosServiceImpl
extends AbstractDeploymentProviderService
implements DeploymentProviderService

      • getJobs

        public Collection<it.infn.ba.indigo.chronos.client.model.v1.Job> getJobs(it.infn.ba.indigo.chronos.client.Chronos client)

      • doDeploy

        public boolean doDeploy(DeploymentMessage deploymentMessage)
        Description copied from interface: DeploymentProviderService
        Executes the deployment of the given deployment, which typically means instantiating the required resources on the underlying system (i.e. IaaS, other service clusters, etc).

        The nodes can be created iteratively (i.e. a given subset for each invocation); the deployment is considered completed when the DeploymentMessage.isCreateComplete() flag is set to true.

        It should handle every error internally (i.e. not throwing exceptions) and just return a boolean indicating the result or the failure.
        It should also handle the deployment status update internally.
        Specified by:
        doDeploy in interface DeploymentProviderService
        Parameters:
        deploymentMessage - the deployment message.
        Returns:
        true if no error happened (this does not mean the deployment is complete, see above), false otherwise.

      • createJobsOnChronosIteratively

        protected boolean createJobsOnChronosIteratively(Deployment deployment,
                                                 Map<String,ChronosServiceImpl.IndigoJob> jobgraph,
                                                 DeploymentMessage.TemplateTopologicalOrderIterator templateTopologicalOrderIterator,
                                                 it.infn.ba.indigo.chronos.client.Chronos client)
        Parameters:
        deployment - the deployment from which create the jobs
        jobgraph - the graph of the jobs
        templateTopologicalOrderIterator - the topological order iterator of the jobs
        client - the Chronos client to use
        Returns:
        true if there are more nodes to create, false otherwise.

      • getJobsTopologicalOrder

        protected List<ChronosServiceImpl.IndigoJob> getJobsTopologicalOrder(Map<String,ChronosServiceImpl.IndigoJob> jobgraph)
        Generate the topological ordering for the given jobGraph.
        Parameters:
        jobgraph - the job graph
        Returns:
        a List of the ChronosServiceImpl.IndigoJob in topological order
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the graph has cycles (hence no topological order exists).

      • isDeployed

        public boolean isDeployed(DeploymentMessage deploymentMessage)
                   throws DeploymentException
        Description copied from interface: DeploymentProviderService
        Checks whether the given deployment is ready.

        The nodes can be checked iteratively (i.e. a given subset for each invocation); the deployment is considered ready when the result of the invocation is true.

        The method should handle node status update internally, but can throw a DeploymentException to notify an unexpected error during the status check.
        Specified by:
        isDeployed in interface DeploymentProviderService
        Parameters:
        deploymentMessage - the deployment message.
        Returns:
        true if the deployment is ready, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException - if the deployment fails.

      • checkJobsOnChronosIteratively

        protected boolean checkJobsOnChronosIteratively(Deployment deployment,
                                                Map<String,ChronosServiceImpl.IndigoJob> jobgraph,
                                                DeploymentMessage.TemplateTopologicalOrderIterator templateTopologicalOrderIterator,
                                                it.infn.ba.indigo.chronos.client.Chronos client)
                                         throws DeploymentException
        Parameters:
        deployment - the deployment from which create the jobs
        jobgraph - the graph of the jobs
        templateTopologicalOrderIterator - the topological order iterator of the jobs
        client - the Chronos client to use
        Returns:
        true if the currently checked node is ready, false if still in progress.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException - if the currently node failed.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • isUndeployed

        public boolean isUndeployed(DeploymentMessage deploymentMessage)
                     throws DeploymentException
        Description copied from interface: DeploymentProviderService
        Checks whether the given deployment is deleted.

        The nodes can be checked iteratively (i.e. a given subset for each invocation); the deployment is considered deleted when the result of the invocation is true.

        The method should handle node status update internally, but can throw a DeploymentException to notify an unexpected error during the status check.
        Specified by:
        isUndeployed in interface DeploymentProviderService
        Parameters:
        deploymentMessage - the deployment message.
        Returns:
        true if the deployment is deleted, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException - if the deployment fails.

      • finalizeUndeploy

        public void finalizeUndeploy(DeploymentMessage deploymentMessage,
                             boolean undeployed)
        Specified by:
        finalizeUndeploy in interface DeploymentProviderService

      • doUndeploy

        public boolean doUndeploy(DeploymentMessage deploymentMessage)
        Deletes all the deployment jobs from Chronos.
        Also logs possible errors and updates the deployment status.
        Specified by:
        doUndeploy in interface DeploymentProviderService
        Parameters:
        deploymentMessage - the deployment message.
        Returns:
        true if all jobs have been deleted, false otherwise.

      • deleteJobsOnChronosIteratively

        protected boolean deleteJobsOnChronosIteratively(Deployment deployment,
                                                 Map<String,ChronosServiceImpl.IndigoJob> jobgraph,
                                                 DeploymentMessage.TemplateTopologicalOrderIterator templateTopologicalOrderIterator,
                                                 it.infn.ba.indigo.chronos.client.Chronos client,
                                                 boolean failAtFirst)
        Deletes all the jobs from Chronos.
        Parameters:
        jobgraph - the job graph.
        client - the Chronos client.
        failAtFirst - if true throws an exception at the first job deletion error, otherwise it tries to delete every other job.
        Returns:
        true if all jobs have been deleted, false otherwise.
